body:
Maven Inspector
==============
As much as Maven makes it easy to deal with builds, the plethora of XML and the varying life cycles phases can sometimes make it hard to figure out what a build will actually do.

To help with this, I've created the "Maven Inspector" plugin for Eclipse. This simple plugin provides an eclipse view called "Maven Execution" that presents for a given pom the phases and associated MOJOs.

How to install it?
------------------


How to use it?
--------------
The Maven execution view shows information about the POM file being edited. To use it:
- Open the Maven Execution view.
- Open a pom file.

The content of the view is refreshed when the pom file is saved.

The "pin" option available from the view toolbar is useful when you are modifying a parent pom but want to keep focus on a "child" pom to see the effect of the changes.
tagline: Figure out what a pom will do
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: Maven Inspector
